Legal_Issue: Whether a stay of removal can be granted due to lawyer's failure to file H&C application
Evidence_Type: Evidence of lawyer's negligence, completed forms, payment receipts, family impact documentation
Basis_of_Claim: Lawyer's failure to file H&C application despite engagement and payment
Evaluation_Standard: Serious issue, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Failure of legal representative to file application
Potential harm to children's education and well-being
Application_Error: Failure to submit humanitarian and compassionate application
Assessment_Standard: Triple test for stay: serious issue, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Legal_Standard: Test for interlocutory stay in immigration context
Application_Factor: Timeliness, completeness of application, reliance on counsel
Authority: Federal Court under inherent jurisdiction and statutory authority
Decision_Review_Issue: Effectiveness of legal representation in immigration process
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Rule 370 of the Federal Courts Rules (Interim remedies)
Evidentiary_Issues: Proof of completed forms and fees paid to lawyer
Procedural_Fairness: Right to fair opportunity to make H&C claim
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Negligence of counsel as basis for equitable relief
Relevant_Law: IRPA, principles of equity and procedural fairness
Procedural_Issue: Timing of application and risk of irremediable harm
